description: Provides the location and metadata of the media files corresponding to timerange segments of a Flow.
title: Flow Segment

object_id.description: The object store identifier for the media object.

ts_offset.description: The timestamp offset between the sample timestamps stored in the media file and the corresponding timestamp in the segment, ie. ts_offset = segment ts - media object ts. Assumed to be 0:0 if not set. Format as described by the [Timestamp](../schemas/timestamp#top) type, but cannot be negative

timerange.description: The timerange from the first sample in the segment to the last, with an inclusive start and inclusive or exclusive end, as described by the [TimeRange](../schemas/timerange#top) type

last_duration.description: The duration of the last sample in the segment (which may differ from that of the object). Defaults to 1/rate if a fixed media rate is set. Format as described by the [Timestamp](../schemas/timestamp#top) type, but cannot be negative

sample_offset.description: The start of the segment represented as a count of samples from the start of the object.

sample_count.description: The count of samples in the segment (which may be fewer than in the object). The count could be less than expected given the segment duration and rate if there are gaps. If not set, every sample from sample_offset onwards is used

get_url.description: A URL to which a GET request can be made to directly retrieve the contents of the segment. This is optional, and not all media store backends may provide it.

key_frame_count.description: The number of key frames in the segment
